name: GitHub
description: OAuth-based GitHub integration for repository management, issues, PRs, and actions.
setupInstructions: GitHub OAuth allows your agent to authenticate as a user or app, accessing repositories, issues, pull requests, and workflows without exposing static tokens.
oauthScopes: repo - Full control of private repositories
steps: Create a GitHub OAuth App at github.com/settings/developers
Set authorization callback URL to your agent's OAuth handler
Configure client ID and client secret in your environment
Initiate OAuth flow from your agent when user connects
Exchange authorization code for access token
Store token securely and refresh when needed (GitHub tokens don't expire but can be revoked)
useCases: Automated PR reviews and code analysis

name: Sentry
description: Error tracking and performance monitoring with OAuth for team access.
setupInstructions: Sentry OAuth enables agents to monitor errors, manage releases, and analyze performance across your applications.
steps: Create a Sentry OAuth application in organization settings
Configure redirect URI for your agent
Implement OAuth flow to obtain access token
Use Sentry REST API with Bearer token
Set up webhooks for real-time error notifications
Tokens are long-lived but should be rotated periodically

name: Linear
description: OAuth-powered project management with GraphQL API for issues and workflows.
setupInstructions: Linear's OAuth flow provides scoped access to workspaces, enabling agents to manage issues, projects, and cycles programmatically.
steps: Register OAuth application in Linear settings
Configure authorized redirect URIs
Initiate authorization with required scopes
Exchange code for access and refresh tokens
Use Linear GraphQL API with Bearer token
Implement token refresh (tokens expire after 10 years)

name: Slack
description: OAuth 2.0 bot and user tokens for workspace automation and messaging.
setupInstructions: Slack OAuth supports both bot tokens (for app actions) and user tokens (for user-specific actions), enabling rich workspace integrations.
oauthScopes: chat:write - Post messages as the app
steps: Create a Slack app at api.slack.com/apps
Configure OAuth scopes (bot vs user)
Set redirect URL for OAuth callback
Install app to workspace via OAuth flow
Receive bot and/or user access tokens
Store tokens securely (they don't expire unless revoked)

name: Notion
description: OAuth integration for workspace access, database queries, and page management.
setupInstructions: Notion OAuth allows agents to access user workspaces with granular permissions, enabling database management and content creation.
oauthScopes: No granular scopes - access controlled by workspace sharing
steps: Create integration at notion.so/my-integrations
Configure OAuth redirect URIs
Initiate OAuth authorization flow
Exchange code for access token
User must manually share pages/databases with integration
Access token is permanent until revoked

name: Jira
description: Atlassian OAuth 2.0 for Jira Cloud access with 3-legged auth flow.
setupInstructions: Jira uses 3-legged OAuth (3LO) with refresh tokens, requiring careful token management and periodic renewal.
oauthScopes: read:jira-work - Read project and issue data
steps: Create OAuth 2.0 app in Atlassian Developer Console
Configure callback URL and scopes
Implement 3-legged OAuth authorization flow
Exchange authorization code for access + refresh tokens
Access tokens expire after 1 hour - implement refresh logic
Refresh tokens expire after 90 days of inactivity

name: Stripe
description: OAuth for Stripe Connect - manage payments on behalf of connected accounts.
setupInstructions: Stripe Connect OAuth enables marketplace and platform integrations where your agent manages payments for connected sellers or service providers.
steps: Enable Stripe Connect in your Stripe Dashboard
Configure OAuth settings and redirect URIs
Initiate OAuth flow for account connection
Exchange authorization code for access token and account ID
Use token to make API calls on behalf of connected account
Tokens are permanent but can be revoked by account owner

name: Vercel
description: OAuth integration for deployment management and project access.
setupInstructions: Vercel OAuth enables agents to deploy projects, manage domains, and access analytics on behalf of users or teams.
oauthScopes: Scopes are implicit based on user/team permissions
steps: Register OAuth integration in Vercel dashboard
Configure redirect URI
Initiate authorization flow
Exchange code for access token
Make API calls with Bearer token
Tokens don't expire but can be revoked

name: Supabase
description: OAuth authentication for Supabase management API and database access.
setupInstructions: Supabase supports OAuth for management API access and also provides service role keys for database operations.
oauthScopes: all - Full access to projects and organizations
steps: Create OAuth app in Supabase dashboard (for management API)
For database access, use project API keys (anon or service_role)
Implement OAuth flow for multi-project management
Use service role key for backend agent operations
Configure Row Level Security (RLS) policies
API keys are project-specific and don't expire

name: PlanetScale
description: Service tokens for MySQL database access with branch management.
setupInstructions: PlanetScale uses service tokens for API access and standard connection strings for database access.
steps: Create service token in PlanetScale dashboard
Configure token permissions (read, write, admin)
Use token for API operations (branches, deploys)
Use connection string for database queries
Implement connection pooling for performance
Rotate tokens periodically for security

name: Datadog
description: API and application keys for monitoring, metrics, and log management.
setupInstructions: Datadog uses API keys for authentication and application keys for user-specific operations.
oauthScopes: N/A - Key-based authentication with role permissions
steps: Generate API key in Datadog Organization Settings
Create application key for your agent
Configure keys in environment variables
Use Datadog API or SDK for operations
Set up monitors and alerts programmatically
Rotate keys periodically according to security policy

name: PostHog
description: API key authentication for product analytics and feature flags.
setupInstructions: PostHog provides personal API keys for management operations and project API keys for event tracking.
steps: Generate personal API key in PostHog settings
Get project API key from project settings
Configure SDK with project key for event tracking
Use personal key for API operations (insights, feature flags)
Implement event batching for performance
Keep keys secure and rotate regularly
